meanings.definition: Unable to be compared or judged by the same standard.
meanings.sent1: The incommensurability sizes of the two objects made it hard to decide which one was bigger.
meanings.sent2: The incommensurability opinions of the students led to a lively debate in class.
meanings.sent3: The incommensurability colors of the mismatched socks made them a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The incommensurability talents of the two artists shone brightly in their unique styles.
meanings.sent5: The incommensurability flavors of the ice cream left everyone wanting to try them all.

meanings.definition: Lack of common measure or standard for comparison.
meanings.sent1: The incommensurability between their tastes in music made it hard to choose a song.
meanings.sent2: The incommensurability of their goals made it challenging to work together effectively.
meanings.sent3: The incommensurability of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The incommensurability of their schedules caused conflicts in planning the event.
meanings.sent5: The incommensurability in their languages created barriers to clear communication.
